result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda M. Hopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is entitled to the Substance Abuse Program after 12 months of Initial Confinement.
Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Waushara Co. Case No. 12CF73.

superMiscConds.notes: Drug buy money joint/several with co-defendants. Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with S. Knaup, B. Messa and/or R. Van directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes:
***Based on Correspondence submitted by the Department of Corrections on November 9, 2017, the Court amends the term of extended supervision to 60 months.***
Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Waushara Co. Case No. 12CF73

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:46 p.m. Defendant Amanda M. Hopp in court with attorney Angela Dawn Henderson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received the PSI- No corrections or clarifications to be made. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. DA Blader - Drug buy money requested of $2035 to be ordered joint/several with S. Knaup and B. Messa. Statement by DE's mother. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Henderson. Statement by DE. Court orders: Court orders: 8 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 30 mos IC/ 66 mos ES Concurrent to any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Waushara Co Case No 12CF73 - 74 days CFTS.  ES Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ S. Knaup, B. Messa and/or R. Van, Costs to include $2035 drug buy money joint/several with the co-defendants - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is eligible for CIP. DE is eligible for SAP any time after completing 12 mos of IC on this case.  Appeal rights given.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 02:45 pm

1:45 pm case called. Defendant Amanda M. Hopp in court with attorney Angela Dawn Henderson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA regarding recommendation of sentence with a request for a PSI. Attorney Henderson concurs. Court questions defendant.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC, and adjourns sentencing. Court orders a PSI be prepared.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing at 07-01-2015 01:45 pm
from Atty Henderson - DE wishes to accept the offer from the State and the Jury Trial can be removed from the calendar

9:47 am case called. Defendant Amanda M. Hopp in court with attorney Angela Dawn Henderson.  Defendant Amanda M. Hopp in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over pre-trial submissions filed by counsel. Court addresses jury instruction packet etc. Court addresses the State's Motion in Limine and 906.09 motions. Discussion between court and counsel. Attorney Henderson objects to the 906.09 motion filed by the State and gives statement. Court admits prior convictions if defendant would choose to testify and makes further statement. Further statement answer-1, if not accurately answered, State would be able to further impeach. Further statement by Attorney Henderson. Court discusses verdict forms with counsel. Court addresses defense motions in limine. Court questions counsel regarding witness and expert testimony. Statement by Attorney Blader. Statement by Attorney Henderson. Court makes a statement regarding testimony. Sequestration order will be in effect during trial. Court goes over further motions. Court declines to further instruct the jury after voir dire. Court discusses other trial issues with security etc. Court addresses hearsay exception. Court denies State's second motion in limine and grants paragraph one of defense motion in limine-provides further instruction. 35 jurors to be brought in. Trial to begin at 8:00 am. Further discussion between court and counsel. Discussion regarding offer being extended. Stated on the record-Court questions defendant regarding offer. Discussion between  counsel and court. State requests a formal rejection be supplied within a week. Court adjourns at 10:36 am.
